# Customer Churn Visualization Implementation\n\n**Implementation Status**: ✅ Complete  \n**Generated By**: DataJames (@data-dev)  \n**Based On**: Specification by DataWinston (@data-architect)  \n**Date**: 2026-01-02\n\n---\n\n## Overview\n\nThis implementation creates 10 comprehensive visualizations for customer churn analysis, covering distribution analysis, churn patterns, and customer demographics.\n\n---\n\n## Files\n\n- **`task.py`**: Main implementation file (691 lines)\n- **`requirements.txt`**: Python dependencies\n- **`README.md`**: This file\n\n---\n\n## Visualizations Generated\n\n### Distribution & Overview\n1. **`01_churn_pie.png`**: Overall churn rate (pie chart)\n2. **`09_contract_distribution.png`**: Contract type distribution (bar)\n3. **`10_payment_distribution.png`**: Payment method distribution (bar)\n\n### Churn Analysis\n4. **`02_churn_by_contract.png`**: Churn by contract type (grouped bar)\n5. **`03_churn_by_payment.png`**: Churn by payment method (grouped bar)\n6. **`04_churn_by_products.png`**: Churn rate by product count (bar)\n7. **`05_churn_by_support.png`**: Churn rate by support calls (bar)\n\n### Demographics & Patterns\n8. **`06_age_histogram.png`**: Customer age distribution (histogram)\n9. **`07_tenure_histogram.png`**: Customer tenure distribution (histogram)\n10. **`08_charges_boxplot.png`**: Monthly charges distribution (box plot)\n\n---\n\n## Installation\n\n```bash\n# Install dependencies\npip install -r requirements.txt\n```\n\n---\n\n## Usage\n\n```bash\n# Basic execution\npython task.py\n\n# Expected output: 10 PNG files in outputs/ directory\n```\n\n---\n\n## Requirements\n\n- Python 3.8+\n- pandas >= 2.0.0\n- numpy >= 1.24.0\n- matplotlib >= 3.7.0\n- seaborn >= 0.12.0\n\n---\n\n## Data Schema\n\n**Expected File**: `data/customer_churn.csv`\n\n**Required Columns** (10):\n- `customer_id` (int): Unique customer identifier\n- `age` (int): Customer age in years\n- `tenure_months` (int): Months with service\n- `monthly_charges` (float): Monthly bill amount ($)\n- `total_charges` (float): Lifetime revenue ($)\n- `num_products` (int): Number of products (1-5)\n- `num_support_calls` (int): Support call count (0-5)\n- `contract_type` (str): Month-to-month, One year, Two year\n- `payment_method` (str): Electronic, Credit card, Bank transfer, Mailed check\n- `churned` (int): 0 (retained) or 1 (churned)\n\n---\n\n## Output\n\n**Directory**: `outputs/`\n\n**Files**: 10 PNG visualizations (sequential numbering)\n\n**Size**: ~1 MB total (100-145 KB per chart)\n\n**DPI**: 100\n\n**Format**: PNG with tight bounding box\n\n---\n\n## Implementation Details\n\n### Task-Based Structure\n\nThe code follows a 5-task implementation plan:\n\n**TASK 1**: Setup & Configuration\n- Imports, color constants, matplotlib configuration\n\n**TASK 2**: Data Loading Function\n- File validation, CSV reading, type conversions\n\n**TASK 3**: Chart Generation Functions\n- 10 separate functions (one per chart)\n- Consistent styling and error handling\n\n**TASK 4**: Main Execution Function\n- Sequential chart generation\n- Progress reporting\n\n**TASK 5**: Quality Assurance\n- Validated against knowledgebase rules\n- No smart quotes (ASCII only)\n- All imports used, all functions documented\n\n---\n\n## Validation\n\n✅ **Syntax**: Valid Python code  \n✅ **Character
